result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy J Ayala was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>2500-10,000 g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served.
Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
Fine is set at ZERO.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $150.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
 Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with any known illegal drug user.
- No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
- No contact with Fausto Image Hair Studio at 1509 W. Lincoln Avenue in Milwaukee, WI.
- Geographic are restriction within area bordered on 
 *North by Highland Blvd., Milwaukee, WI  South by Michigan Street, Milwaukee, WI  East by 21st Street, Milwaukee WI and West by 35th Street, Milwaukee, WI.

Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

timeConds.notes: Without good time credit; release for The Day Reporting Center (if eligible), work, and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring for the first 6 MONTHS.  Court notes no objection to electronic monitoring months 7 to 12 if defendant verified work or is participating in Day Reporting Center.

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Billy J Ayala in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
 - No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $150.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to you name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept. 
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present. 
- Maintain fulltime work. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with any known illegal drug user.
- No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
- No contact with Fausto Image Hair Studio at 1509 W. Lincoln Avenue in Milwaukee, WI.
- Geographic are restriction within area bordered on 
*North by Highland Blvd., Milwaukee, WI  South by Michigan Street, Milwaukee, WI  East by 21st Street, Milwaukee WI and West by 35th Street, Milwaukee, WI.
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS condition time in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center (if eligible), work, and inmate work assignments. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring for the first 6 MONTHS.  Court notes no objection to electronic monitoring months 7 to 12 if defendant verified work or is participating in Day Reporting Center. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk
Parties notified to pick up copies in Branch 17.

Defendant Billy J Ayala in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
AS TO COUNT  1- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Court ordered a presentence investigation without a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 
Case is adjourned for Sentencing Hearing on 5-29-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Billy J Ayala in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Brandon Wigley for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record for the purposes of scheduling. Defense has received discovery. Case is adjourned for Projected Plea and Sentencing on 3-26-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
Any Defense motion due on 3-26-2015 at 8:30 a.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Billy J Ayala in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Lindsey Anderson, student intern under the supervision of Ron Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Dawn Maldonado.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MARIA M-L. AND 5 BLOCKS  OF THE INTERSECTION OF N. 27TH AND W. WELLS STREETS IN MILWAUKEE, WI.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Billy J Ayala in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Billy J Ayala in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge STARK, Branch 17.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
